name: Theo Gevers
content: Prof. dr. Theo Gevers Prof. dr. Theo Gevers About me CV Publications Press Theo Gevers is a professor of Computer Vision (Artificial Intelligence) at the University of Amsterdam. He is director of the Computer Vision Research Group and co-director of the Atlas Lab (UvA-TomTom) and Delta Lab (UvA-Bosch). His research area is (generative) artificial intelligence with the focus on computer vision and deep learning, and in particular image understanding, 3D (object) reconstruction and recognition with industrial and societal applications. He is a VICI laureate (prestigious Dutch research grant). He is the co-founder of 3DUniversum, Scanm (Sold in 2020), and Sightcorp (Sold in 2022). He has published over 300 scientific articles and 3 books with a total number of citations of more than 30,000. For current information regarding his H-index and number of publications, consult Google Scholar. He is organizer, general chair, and program committee member of a various number of conferences, and an invited speaker at major conferences. He is actively engaged in media and dissemination activities with contributions on TV, newspapers, and magazines. Article nu.nl 16-12-2022: Deepfakes can also be helpful DataNews 02-12-2022: Article in de Volkskrant about deepfake therapy and the question whether talking to a perpetrator or deceased partner can help to process a trauma or unpleasant event. 13-11-2022: Perpetrator confrontation using deepfake technology with victims with sexual violence-related PTSD and moral injury. The platform deeptherapy.ai, is developed by 3DUniversum. Article in Frontiers in Psychiatry, A live intervention was broadcast on TV: Welmoed and the sexfakes (time 09:30), and the topic is covered in different newspapers: Trouw, Leidsch Dagblad , KIJK . 23-09-2022: Delta Lab 2 was officially opened. The UvA and world-leading technology company Bosch have agreed to extend their established collaboration with the launch of a new public-private research lab. Within this collaboration, I am happy to act as the scientific co-director together with Dr Jan-Willem van de Meent. Dr. Eric Nalisnick will be the daily lab manager. Delta Lab 2 will focus on the use of artificial intelligence and machine learning for applications in computer vision, generative models and causal learning. 15-09-2022: The Atlas Lab (https://icai.ai/atlas-lab/) was festively opened. Within this collaboration, I am happy to act as the scientific co-director together with Prof. dr. Cees Snoek, and Dr. Martin Oswald as the lab manager. The Atlas Lab is a collaboration between TomTom and the Universiteit van Amsterdam (UvA). The public-private research lab focuses on using Artificial Intelligence (AI) for developing advanced, highly accurate and safe high definition (HD) maps for self-driving vehicles. 09-09-2022: 3DUniversum, spin-off of the Informatics Institute awarded EUR 1M grant. 3DUniversum founded by Theo Gevers and Sezer Karaoglu of the Informatics Institute, is awarded EUR 1M grant to co-develop the first self-test STD kit that you can do at home with instant results. The grant is for the FASTDetection project (with a total amount of EUR 2,7M) through the Eurostars Programme. Partners are Testmate Health SA and University Hospital of Geneva. Read more: Article at IvI-UvA 23-05-2022: Police have posted a deepfake video online in which a 13-year-old victim calls on his killer and witnesses to come forward: (1) Paudal, and (in Dutch): (2) NOS 8 uur Journaal (time 11:33), (3) NOS, (4) Trouw, and (5) Digitale overheid. 18-03-2022: Theo Gevers, co-director of new research lab (EUR 5.2 million funding for a total of 10 PhD students for 4 years) - Delta Lab - collaboration between UvA and Bosch 12-01-2022: Sightcorp (spin-off Informatics Institute) acquired by Raydiant. Sightcorp has been founded by prof. dr. Theo Gevers and dr. Roberto Valenti as a spin-off of the Informatics Institute. The years of its founding, technical development and commercialization have been inspiring, fun and challenging. Sightcorp has now been sold to Raydiant who will take over the team, company name and technology. Sightcorp's product and related academic research have received attention and appreciation from all over the world. It has shined in the (inter) national press at DWDD, RTL, BBC, CNN, Bloomberg, TV5, etc. 22-09-2021: TV item featuring 3DUniversum technology, NPO 2 16-09-2021: Faceswap by 3DUniversum of Britt Dekker (deepfake starts at 3:00 minutes) to inform children about deepfakes: NPO Zapp. 15-07-2021: The truth of deepfake.
